caption.title: Satellite image of the damage to Paradise, California from the Camp Fire as of November 16, 2018.
caption.p: "The map was developed using synthetic aperture radar images from the Copernicus Sentinel-1 satellites operated by the European Space Agency. The map covers an area of 48 miles by 48 miles (78 by 77 kilometers), outlined in red on left. A closeup view of damage to the town of Paradise is inset on right, outlined in white. The color variation from yellow to red indicates increasingly more significant changes in the ground surface."
Courtesy NASA/Jet Propulsion Laboratory-California Institute of Technology (JPL-CalTech).Â https://www.jpl.nasa.gov/news/news.php?feature=7278. Accessed 02/15/2019
